description: This course will introduce students to the basics of computer networking with an emphasis on IEEE 802.XX standards (primarily 802.3 and 802.11) and popular RFCs. The course will also cover popular distance vector, path vector, and link-state routing protocols, primarily RIP, OSPF, and BGP. Students will be introduced to the concepts and terminology of networks, including layered network models, and to practical issues involved in designing, managing, and using networks and network applications. Learning will take place through assigned readings, exercises, labs, class participation, and homework assignments.  Grades will be based on examinations, labs, homework assignments, and contributions to classroom discussions. For Information Systems Juniors and Seniors.
